page.title: 17WATERWAYS HOWE GREEN C'FORD
page.content: Forty years ago the owner, for a hobby, had a pair of Carolina Ducks.Now he has over 350 ducks,many geese,parakeets,free flying budgerigars and black swans.In fact there are over 45 different species of birds there.Waterways was one the first places in England to have a pair of Laysan Teal.Once there were only seven in the world,now there are thousands.The ducks are fed twice a day on chicken food.There is a little pool in each compartment for the ducks to bathe in.The water is pumped from a nearby stream.They use 3,000 gallons an hour.All of the wildfowl are hatched under bantams and only the domestic ducks and geese are hatched in incubators.
